column5: Hi all, I was wondering if you could take a look at these pictures and critique this portable filet table design. It's aluminum, so it's very solid and light. Could you see yourself using this? What additional features would be good? I'm just helping a friend develop it.http://i16.photobucket.com/albums/b2...lettable11.jpghttp://i16.photobucket.com/albums/b2...lettable22.jpg
Neat idea. Add something to hold a plastic bag open to receive fish guts.
I'd hate to hit my blade on it. I would assume you'd put a board down on top of it? I like the idea though...portable and looks to be nice and stable for doing the job... Steve

That was my thought at first, that I didn't want to cut on a metal surface. He said that Aluminum was incredibly soft and shouldn't dull your blade much, but I'm not so sure. I suggested maybe screwing plastic cutting sheet material on top.
Replace the aluminum top with white board. It is available in large sheets or smaller sheets. This is the stuff used on fishing boats for bait stations. Good stuff.
I agree. The top should be something other than aluminum. Not only because of dulling blades, but I think the aluminum would get too slippery during use.

I agree! Good looking design but I would put a cutting board on top. The al. will get to slippery with fish slime and I wouldn't want my blade running into it. Also a device to hold open a bag for guts would be nice!
